parameters.description: Return only templates with the given template IDs.
parameters.name: templateids

parameters.description: Return only templates that belong to the given template groups.
parameters.name: groupids

parameters.description: Return only templates that the given template is linked to.
parameters.name: parentTemplateids

parameters.description: Return only templates that are linked to the given hosts/templates.
parameters.name: hostids

parameters.description: Return only templates that contain the given graphs.
parameters.name: graphids

parameters.description: Return only templates that contain the given items.
parameters.name: itemids

parameters.description: Return only templates that contain the given triggers.
parameters.name: triggerids

parameters.description: Return only templates that have items.
parameters.name: with_items

parameters.description: Return only templates that have triggers.
parameters.name: with_triggers

parameters.description: Return only templates that have graphs.
parameters.name: with_graphs

parameters.description: Return only templates that have web scenarios.
parameters.name: with_httptests

parameters.description:
Rules for tag searching.

Possible values:
0 - (default) And/Or;
2 - Or.
parameters.name: evaltype

parameters.description:
Return only templates with given tags. Exact match by tag and case-sensitive or case-insensitive search by tag value depending on operator value.
Format: [{"tag": "<tag>", "value": "<value>", "operator": "<operator>"}, ...].
An empty array returns all templates.

Possible operator values:
0 - (default) Contains;
1 - Equals;
2 - Not like;
3 - Not equal;
4 - Exists;
5 - Not exists.
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: Return template tags in the tags property.
parameters.name: selectTags

parameters.description:
Return the hosts that are linked to the template in the hosts property.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectHosts

parameters.description: Return the template groups that the template belongs to in the templategroups property.
parameters.name: selectTemplateGroups

parameters.description:
Return templates to which the given template is linked in the templates property.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectTemplates

parameters.description:
Return templates that are linked to the given template in the parentTemplates property.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectParentTemplates

parameters.description:
Return the web scenarios from the template in the httpTests property.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectHttpTests

parameters.description:
Return items from the template in the items property.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectItems

parameters.description:
Return low-level discoveries from the template in the discoveries property.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectDiscoveries

parameters.description:
Return triggers from the template in the triggers property.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectTriggers

parameters.description:
Return graphs from the template in the graphs property.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectGraphs

parameters.description: Return the macros from the template in the macros property.
parameters.name: selectMacros

parameters.description:
Return dashboards from the template in the dashboards property.

Supports count.
parameters.name: selectDashboards

parameters.description: Return a valuemaps property with template value maps.
parameters.name: selectValueMaps

parameters.description:
Limits the number of records returned by subselects.

Applies to the following subselects:
selectTemplates - results will be sorted by name;
selectHosts - sorted by host;
selectParentTemplates - sorted by host;
selectItems - sorted by name;
selectDiscoveries - sorted by name;
selectTriggers - sorted by description;
selectGraphs - sorted by name;
selectDashboards - sorted by name.
parameters.name: limitSelects

parameters.description:
Sort the result by the given properties.

Possible values: hostid, host, name, status.
parameters.name: sortfield

parameters.description: rowspan="12">These parameters being common for all get methods are described in detail in the reference commentary.
parameters.name: countOutput

parameters.description:
This parameter is deprecated, please use selectTemplateGroups instead.
Return the template groups that the template belongs to in the groups property.
parameters.name:
selectGroups
(deprecated)

parameters.description: Return the number of records in the result instead of the actual data.
parameters.name: countOutput

parameters.description: If set to true return only objects that the user has write permissions to.  Default: false.
parameters.name: editable

parameters.description: Return results that do not match the criteria given in the search parameter.
parameters.name: excludeSearch

parameters.description: Return only those results that exactly match the given filter. Accepts an array, where the keys are property names, and the values are either a single value or an array of values to match against. Doesn't work for text fields.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: Limit the number of records returned.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Object properties to be returned. Default: extend.
parameters.name: output

parameters.description: Use IDs as keys in the resulting array.
parameters.name: preservekeys

parameters.description: Return results that match the given wildcard search (case-insensitive). Accepts an array, where the keys are property names, and the values are strings to search for. If no additional options are given, this will perform a LIKE "%â€¦%" search. Works only for string and text fields.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: If set to true return results that match any of the criteria given in the filter or search parameter instead of all of them. Default: false.
parameters.name: searchByAny

parameters.description: If set to true enables the use of "*" as a wildcard character in the search parameter. Default: false.
parameters.name: searchWildcardsEnabled

parameters.description: Sort the result by the given properties. Refer to a specific API get method description for a list of properties that can be used for sorting. Macros are not expanded before sorting. If no value is specified, data will be returned unsorted.
parameters.name: sortfield

parameters.description: Order of sorting. If an array is passed, each value will be matched to the corresponding property given in the sortfield parameter.
parameters.name: sortorder

parameters.description: The search parameter will compare the beginning of fields, that is, perform a LIKE "â€¦%" search instead. Ignored if searchWildcardsEnabled is set to true.
parameters.name: startSearch
